photo.title: Castel Nuovo Napoli, Naples 1960. Maschio Angioino

photo.description: From Wikipedia: Castel Nuovo, often called Maschio Angioino, is a castle in the city of Naples, southern Italy. It is the main symbol of the architecture of the city. Castel Nuovo has been expanded or renovated several times since it was first begun in 1279. View On Black Back to Italy - Visit the World
photo.tags: italia italy naples napoli campania castle castelnuovo castel nuovo newcastle maschioangioino maschio angioino europe travel canon sd450 canonsd450
photo.title: Castel Nuovo

photo.description: Castel Nuovo, meglio noto come Maschio Angioino, è uno storico castello medievale e rinascimentale, nonché uno dei simboli della città di Napoli. Il castello domina la scenografica piazza Municipio ed è sede della Società napoletana di storia patria e del Comitato di Napoli dell'Istituto per la storia del Risorgimento italiano, ospitato nei locali della SNSP. Nel complesso è situato anche il Museo civico della città di Napoli, cui pertengono la Cappella palatina e i percorsi museali del primo e secondo piano. La Fondazione Valenzi vi ha la sua sede di rappresentanza, inaugurata il 15 novembre 2009 dal presidente della Repubblica Giorgio Napolitano ed altre autorità, nell'ambito della celebrazione dei cento anni dalla nascita di Maurizio Valenzi. Il castello, infine, è sede del museo civico di Napoli. --------------------------------------- O Castel Nuovo, também conhecido pelo nome de Maschio Angioino, é um castelo na cidade de Nápoles, na Itália. Sua construção foi iniciada em 1279, por ordem de Carlos I de Anjou, sendo completada três anos mais tarde, mas permaneceu desabitado até 1285, quando foi ocupado por Carlos II de Nápoles. Sob o reinado de Roberto I de Nápoles o castelo foi ampliado e embelezado, tornando-se um centro de patronato artístico, mas em 1347 foi saqueado pela armada húngara, sendo gravemente danificado. Restaurado e fortificado por Joana I de Nápoles, tornou-se uma resistente fortaleza contra vários assédios subsequentes. Sob a dinastia aragonesa as estruturas foram renovadas. Afonso V de Aragão mandou construir um grande arco triunfal no pórtico, obra de Francesco Laurana. Depois do saque de Nápoles em 1494 pelos franceses, o castelo deixou de ser residência real e assumiu a função de fortaleza militar, voltando a ser ocupado pela realeza no século XVIII. ---------------------------------------------------- New Castle, better known as Maschio Angevin, is a historic medieval castle and Renaissance, as well as a symbol of the city of Naples. The castle dominates the spectacular Piazza Municipio and Naples is home to the Company's history and home of the Naples Board of the Institute for the History of the Italian Risorgimento, housed in the premises of SNSP. The complex is also located the Museum of Naples, which pertain to the Palatine Chapel and museum tours the first and second floor. The Foundation will Valenzi has its representative office, which opened November 15, 2009 by President Giorgio Napolitano and other authorities, as part of the celebration of the centennial of the birth of Maurice Valenzi. The castle, finally, is home to the museum of Naples

photo.title: Maschio Angioino

photo.description: In Piazza Municipio in Naples. This time walking past it. Another look at Maschio Angioino. View of a castle in Naples (other side of construction site) - the Maschio Angioino. New Castle, better known as Maschio Angevin, is a historic medieval castle and Renaissance, as well as a symbol of the city of Naples . The castle dominates the spectacular Piazza Municipio and home to the country's history of Neapolitan Society and the Committee of the Naples' Institute for the History of the Italian Risorgimento , housed in the premises of SNSP . The complex is also located the Museum of Naples , which pertain to the Palatine Chapel and museum tours the first and second floor. The Foundation will Valenzi has its representative office, which opened November 15, 2009 by President Giorgio Napolitano and other authorities, as part of the celebration of the centennial of the birth of Maurice Valenzi . The castle, finally, is home to the museum of Naples . It dates back to 1266 by Charles I of Anjou. Construction work for the Metro underground extension. They found a Roman port down here (they always seem to find things like that under Naples!).

photo.title: Encantadora........

photo.description: This "new castle" dates from the 13th Century after the capital of the Kingdom of Naples was moved from Palermo to Naples. It was built between 1279 and 1282 by comission of King Charles I of Anjou, a French nobleman and ruler of the region from whom the castle derives its original name, the Maschio Angioino- literally the "Angevin Keep." It was referred to as the "new" castle after extensive renovations were commissioned by Alfonso of Aragon, following his victory over the French in 1442 . The castle was controlled or attacked at various times throughout its history by the French, Hungarians and Spanish, in addition to the local population of Italians. It sits right near the shoreline and offers a commanding view of the harbor and the city, and features a few faded frescoes by Giotto in the chapel, as well as the local Neapolitan Society of National History and the Civic Museum, which both house numerous rare and original manuscripts, drawings, prints, and various artworks from around the the region.
photo.tags: italy italiavacation naples napoli castle castel nuovo
photo.title: Castel Nuovo - Naples, Italy

photo.description: Restless This shot was made into the Parthenope University park, Acton street, Naples. This castle is called "Maschio Angioino" and it is located near the seaport and "Municipio" Place. I made this photo during my walk from workplace (the University itself) to the Toledo street. I was wondering about Life. --- Il Maschio Angioino. Uscendo dall'Università, dopo il lavoro. Pochi minuti dopo le cinque, se non ricordo male. Le ultime luci del giorno svaniscono per dare posto alla sera; sul torrione del castello i fari proiettano fasci di bianco che creano un gioco di luci ed ombre impressionante. E viene da farsi domande sulla Vita. [Nokia 6630]
photo.tags: gdlabs gianfranco reppucci naples napoli italy italia castello castle maschio angioino torre tower cielo sky dark blue blu notte night sera camminando walking pensieri thinking gdlabsit
photo.title: L'Inquietudine

photo.title: Napoli, Cappella Palatina Madonna col Bambino

photo.description: L'eccidio di Cefalonia fu una strage compiuta durante la seconda guerra mondiale sull'isola greca di Cefalonia da reparti dell'esercito tedesco ai danni dei soldati italiani dopo l'8 settembre 1943, data in cui fu reso pubblico l'armistizio firmato con gli anglo-americani. Il presidio italiano all'epoca era formato dalla Divisione Acqui dell'esercito, dalla 2a Compagnia del VII Battaglione Carabinieri Mobilitato più la 27a Sezione Mista Carabinieri, da reparti del I° Battaglione Finanzieri Mobilitato, dai marinai che presidiavano le batterie costiere (una da 152 ed una da 120 mm) ed il locale Comando Marina, dal 110° Btg. Mitraglieri di corpo d'armata, tre ospedali da campo ed altre unità tra le quali il 188° gruppo artiglieria di corpo d'armata (con tre batterie da 155/14) ed il 3° gruppo contraereo da 75/27, per un totale di circa 12.000 uomini. La guarnigione di stanza nell'isola greca fu sterminata nonostante la resa incondizionata dopo alcuni giorni di sanguinosi combattimenti. Questa è la storia....che qualcuno vuole "obliare" con i racconti dei treni che arrivavano in orario......del non si rubava nulla.....e tante fesserie del genere....ci vogliono riempire la testa di fumo come sui"ragazzi di Salò" se qualcuno ha comprato il venerdì di repubblica la scorsa settimana gli consiglio di leggere quello che ne pensa Giorgio Bocca.....a me il clima non piace e nemmeno l'abbigliamento del nostro primo ministro mi ricorda troppe brutte cose...e per dirla alla De Gregori "....a giocare col nero perdi sempre..."
photo.tags: campania napoli maschioangioino eccidiodicefalonia lapide tonemapped frame geotagged bej novavitanewlife proudshopper
photo.title: Onore ai caduti

photo.description: In Piazza Municipio in Naples. This time walking past it. Another look at Maschio Angioino. View of a castle in Naples (other side of construction site) - the Maschio Angioino. New Castle, better known as Maschio Angevin, is a historic medieval castle and Renaissance, as well as a symbol of the city of Naples . The castle dominates the spectacular Piazza Municipio and home to the country's history of Neapolitan Society and the Committee of the Naples' Institute for the History of the Italian Risorgimento , housed in the premises of SNSP . The complex is also located the Museum of Naples , which pertain to the Palatine Chapel and museum tours the first and second floor. The Foundation will Valenzi has its representative office, which opened November 15, 2009 by President Giorgio Napolitano and other authorities, as part of the celebration of the centennial of the birth of Maurice Valenzi . The castle, finally, is home to the museum of Naples . It dates back to 1266 by Charles I of Anjou. Construction work for the Metro underground extension. They found a Roman port down here (they always seem to find things like that under Naples!). A crane on site for the Metro extension works.

photo.description: Castel Nuovo (Italian: New Castle), often called Maschio Angioino, is a castle in the city of Naples, southern Italy. It is the main symbol of the architecture of the city.
